description:
This pizza place is right next door to my work office and it is legit the only pizza place I will go to for lunch, whenever I visit the office.

Working in LDAC has it's perks - such a company paid lunches at the LDAC cafeteria, but the one thing that the cafeteria cannot beat is delicious Pizza from Pizzeria Avellino. 

5/5 Stars for HUGE Slices
5/5 Stars for their quickness from ordering to getting the slice in your hand and in your stomach
5/5 Stars for the service. They are super friendly and very quick on their feet

Every slice is unique and full of flavor; and their crust is charred perfectly!

Want a quick bite? or craving pizza? This place is a MUST! Depending on the time, there is plenty of parking on the street, they also have a small lot next to their shop - that houses like 5 cars.

5 Stars for sure! Only a few pizza places gets me worked up and this one is it
author: -Johnson- N.

description:
"New Owner? Who Dis??"

Growing up in the Suburbs, I'm well versed in pizza. You know, Pizza Hut, Little Caesar's, Round Table. All that good stuff. Hey, it may not be the best, but at least it's always consistent.

This place on the other hand, you never know what you're going to get. Sometimes you'll get a super friendly dude serving up a fresh slice, other times you'll wonder why you came here in the first place.

With the new owners they're trying to implement some innovations like pizza sitting on the front counter. Speeds things up a bit if you want a quick slice, but you can also order a custom slice if you want a fresh one.

There are also wings and salads sold here. But my favorite thing is the Sicilian style pizza. However that's a bit inconsistent too. Sometimes it's an inch high sometimes maybe triple that (???).

The prices are a bit on the high side approaching about $30 for a whole pizza. Definitely not a 5-5-5 kind of place, but there really aren't too many other pizza options in the immediate area. 

Overall if you want pizza it's either this Delarosa....and they know it! Alas my weakness is pizza so I'll be back again and again.

Protip: Bring cash. Otherwise you'll pay a ~4% additional charge
author: Joel L.

description:
Man. I hate to do this but, the new ownership has really ruined this place by skimping on quality ingredients and Avellino has officially lost its "soul". The new owners are looking at the bottom line more than putting out a good NY slice and it makes me sadder than ever. 

For the better part of a decade I enjoyed the delicious nyc styled pizza but, those days are gone. The slice and pizza you find today is uninspired, clunky and cheese heavy. Honestly, round table would crush this place in a blind tasting...I know, sad. 

Anyway, someone had to say it because the collective 4 stars aren't an accurate representation of what's coming out of the kitchen today. :(
author: Benjamin F.

description:
We ordered one large and one medium pizza and an arugula salad. In my opinion, the salad was the best part. The pickled onions and roasted tomatoes paired well with the balsamic vinegarette they had, which was extra tangy and super flavorful. I used the whole container, but would probably opt for just half next time!

Sadly, the pizza disappointed. Ultimately, you can't go too wrong with pizza, they give you good portion size for the price. A medium here is like a large elsewhere. Plus, service is quick because the pizza is thin-crusted. 

However, the chicken on the pizza was dry and flavorless, sauce unseasoned, and crust unremarkable. Our other pizza (forgot its name, but it had arugula and sausage) was way too greasy. If you're looking for a quick bite to eat and are craving pizza you can come here--but don't expect it to blow you away.
author: Rachel L.

description: Omg.  Pizza by the slice. 50 a topping. Made to order and cook's fast. They bring it to table.verry friendly. Delicious toppings awesome cheese. Fluffy crust. I haven't yelped anything in awhile. But for this place I had that good.
author: Debbie H.

description: Came here after House of Air because it was close and so glad we did.  The pizza is delicious!!! Ordered a large Brooklyn Italian and Large Cheese/Pepperoni.  Pizza is so light that we ordered another "round" of pizza.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Ordered the meatball sandwich and the Caprese sandwich. The meatballs were just okay. It had a very interesting flavor. The Caprese sandwich was also just okay. The service was not friendly. But the place was very crowded. It is a cute very small restaurant but I do not think I would return for either sandwich. 
Both came with lays potato chips.
author: Nellie P.

description:
3.5 STARS

For dinner, the roommate wanted pizza. I gave him a couple options and he picked Pizzeria Avellino. We place a delivery order on the way home via DoorDash on Monday, February 26th at 5:36pm. Our order arrived at 6:40pm. We live in Outer Richmond.

*The Lombard Special: Pepperoni, Italian sausage, mushrooms, no black olives, sub Jalapenos ($22 for Medium 15")
*Blistered Shishito Peppers: Tossed in olive oil and sea salt over lemon aioli ($6)
*Meatballs: Pork and beef meatballs, marinara, parmesan, crostini ($7)

I like thin crust pizza, so this was more my style. The pizza was pretty big circumference wise for a medium. Managed to feed both of us for this one meal. (I had two slices and the roomie had the rest.) The crust was soft, but also had a nice chew. A good amount of cheese and toppings as well. I adore shishito peppers, so I enjoyed these. Could have used a little more seasoning, but the lemon aioli helped. The portion was pretty hefty as this was the one dish we couldn't finish. I thought the meatballs were pretty standard. Though one wasn't quite a whole meatball. It almost looked like someone had a bite taken out of it? I know that wasn't the case, but I did notice one was smaller than the rest. I do love my meat and sauce, so this fulfilled that craving.

Even though the roommate just prefers to order from a particular chain pizza restaurant, I like trying new spots. Not necessarily on my list of go-tos for pizza delivery, but I'm glad I tried them out.
author: Elena N.

description: New owners from back in April. When we got there the cheese pizza looked like it had been sitting there since 1496. When we asked when it came out of the oven the guy just said "I don't know." We decided to leave it just didn't feel like the old place - definitely not a New York feel anymore.
author: Dennis S.

description: Had the most amazing experience tonight at this small pizza place.   My sister and brother and his wife and I were all out late looking for a late nite pizza , drove by and looked closed , chairs up and stuff.   We decides to check if any leftovers.   Walked in meet Handsome Jacob!     And Wow was he nice!    He had some slices still and even though closed offer to heat up and sell to us.   OMG....   the taste...  the crust.... the freshness......and the service........  The Stuart's are coming back.
author: Tracy S.

description: Son and I were looking for something to eat for lunch. We walked off the Presidio and found Pizzeria Avellino. The restaurant is an older place and its is small. They do offer some outside seating which is helpful. We ordered two slices of cheese pizza and one slice of a combo plus two sodas. The cost of this came to $19. At first I was shocked but then realized NY slice means huge. When the pizza came I was kind of disappointed. It appears they took a cheese pizza and placed some toppings on it and sent it back through the oven. I could be wrong but the veggies seemed too fresh for going through a 500 degree oven. I also felt the sauce was meh. All in all I felt the experience was meh.
author: Don P.

description:
Good for a NY slice!

This is the best version of NY slice style pizza that I've found in San Francisco. Probably better than most of the Tony Slice House locations. 

There are many decent Italian style wood fired pizza places around town. And, also lots of thin, crispy crust artisanal, local California ingredient type places. But, the neighborhood-type NYC places have been lacking.  I don't know Chicago-style well enough, but there seem to be enough of those as well. 

The pizzas are good here; either by the pie or by the slice. Go for something simple with fewer ingredients. They also have some good appetizers that go well with beer; try the padron peppers. They have now also added some outdoor tables in the parking lot area -- great for when the weather is cooperating and it's not too cold and windy. 

Next time you are tempted to order a chain pizza, or visit a NY themed place, go here instead.
author: Jice E.

description:
This is a hole in the wall at the end of Lombard St, by the Presidio.  It's usually quiet with no wait, unlike most places in SF.  It's ain't too fancy--basically a enlarged pizza stand with indoor and outdoor seating.  The place is small and we love visiting when it's sunny, after hiking walking around the park nearby or running the Lyon St. stairs.  The people that work there are nice and super chillllll....

Pizzas are great and they have bottomless mimosas on Sundays.  Both good things after a late Saturday night.
author: Amy J.

description: I am sad to say that this is definitely not NYC pizza.  It is not even close to the worst that I have had in NYC and I grew up there!  Yes, the crust is thin, but not chewy and way underdone.  Also, the people working there don't seem happy to be there.  Will not be going back.
author: Sammy S.

description:
I had a team lunch here after going to the escape room. The staff was super helpful with pre-ordering the food so that once we arrived the pies were ready. All pizza and salads were fresh and delicious! 

We sat outside in the patio as it was a nice day out and we got to enjoy the presidio across the street.
author: Carter L.

description:
This could have been a 5 star but the dough was undercooked. No crunch. Pale bottom.
This could be the first time ever where i could say there was too much cheese. Great quality, sauce, size.
author: Scotty L.

description: This is small cosy restaurant in San Francisco which serves one of the best pizzas. We had a custom made pizza with garlic spinach and onions. I loved the flavor of the soft slightly roasted garlic with other toppings. The pizza was delicious and the service was quick too.
author: Bhawna J.

description:
Hidden charge disguised as a discount!

Called to order 3 pizzas.  They gave me a price. 
Picked the pizzas up, they charged my card - Looked at the receipt - it was a few dollars more than the price they had told me on the phone.  

Looking closer I notice an extra charge called something like "pay with cash discount".

You heard that right - an extra charge called a discount.  Meaning - if I had paid with cash, I would have gotten a discount but instead I got an extra charge.  Ridiculous.  

Rather than disputing the charge, I decided not to do business with them again.  Why do business with someone who has hidden charges?

The guy behind the counter was very friendly.

The pizza was OK.
author: mike s.

description:
NYC friends visiting loved it.
 We had friends visiting us from NYC via Denver. They said it was closest thing they've had to NY pizza outside of NY! I think one of them teared up @ the Bodega pics on the wall. (aww) I teared up a little from the garlic dust on the napkin holders (aww) I got the Lombard slice & a Chicken Pesto slice & a blood orange Pellegrino for $13.50 & that's not bad for SF. Slices big enough I couldn't finish the 2nd slice. It was a little greasy but very very tasty. Definitely worth the cheat day lol
author: Leana M.

description:
These guys are the best. I live in the neighborhood so I've had my fair share of slices here. Both the Sicilian and the NY style are good, but I'm probably more partial to the NY style. :) 
Pizza slices are made to order, (no weird sitting in a circular warmer wondering how long it's been there). And you can pick your toppings at 50 cents each. Always have a "slice of the day" they feature. They also have a new great selection of beers. Great outdoor patio for a sunny day or if you have a furry friend!! Thanks Pizzeria Avellino for providing the Presidio with such good pizza.
author: Courtney M.

description: If you're looking for a quick cheap slice that just gets the job done, this is your spot. The time for them to flash cook the slices is pretty short, but that leaves a lot of the fresher ingredients coming out pretty raw (Nothing like some raw garlic). I tried a pepperoni and Italian sausage and can't rave about the quality or taste of the ingredients. There's a nice patio at back that's actually pretty nice to enjoy and beer and a slice. We all have that time we want to chill with a greasy slice and a beer- during those times... this place does the trick.
author: Jessen J.

description:
If you don't like this pizza, we cannot be friends. I've had a lot of excellent (East coast) pizza during the bay area's pizza renaissance. If this isn't a contender for the best East coast pizza of them all, tell me what is and I will tell you why you are wrong.

This pie achieves the golden ratio; each bite is a madeleine (as in Proustian) moment.
author: Brski B.

description: Excellent meatball sub.  Toasted, homemade meatballs.  Yum.  Great slices of think and thin crust. Slice of the day specials.
author: Dave L.

description:
I got the pizza by the slice! Deep dish is $5/slice and the thin crust is $4/slice. Each topping costs 50 cents. And there are a lot of toppings to choose from! 

Small and comfy atmosphere inside, but there are also a lot of tables outside with a view of the park entrance. 

The deep dishes were filling and you'll probably get a food coma afterwards. 2 slices is definitely enough to satiate the largest of appetites :)
author: Leo W.

description:
You' think finding a great pizza-by-the-slice spot in San Francisco would be easy. Actually, it's surprisingly hard, at least when it comes to a quality slice cooked just right with all the right toppings. Pizzeria Avellino has become my new reference point as one of the best fast-casual pizza joints in the city by the bay. 

I was killing time waiting for my friend and needed an answer to my hunger pangs. Pizzeria Avellino was the first and closest thing to pop up on my Yelp map, so rather than spend half an hour debating and comparing it to other possibilities, I figured "Why not?" I ordered a slice, which was big enough to be two slices anywhere else with my usual favorite toppings: pepproni, mushrooms, tomatoes, onions, olives and bell peppers. It came out quick and I sat by the window enjoying each bite with a sprinkle from my own private condiment rack. 

It wasn't the nicest of days when I came in but the picnic table around the corner next to the Presidio seem like a grand place to eat lunch on a rare sunny SF day. I'll note that for my return visit.
author: Alex L.

description: I like their pizza and delivery was usually fast.  Last time however, pizza was almost an hour late and, of course, cold by the time it arrived.  I told Grubhub all about it but they did nothing.  Wanted to like this place but hard to order delivery from there now.
author: John M.

description: Pizza was good, but then the kitchen started blasting hip hop music with lots of N-word and cussing.
author: Matt T.

description: Excellent pizza at a very good price. Place was spare and simple but the amazing pie that we were served transported us to pizza paradise!
author: Victor F.

description: Hmm 10$ for their famous sausage sandwich was pretty good. But for 7$ you can get a good sandwich at safeway.  Inside can get hot. But right around the corner is a nice park. Maybe the pizzas are better. Not sure if theres a bathroom. Theres a bathroom at starbucks across the street
author: jerrell m.

description:
Authentic NY style pizza at its best. And the guy on the phone that took my order was super busy taking orders and he was extremely polite. 
Way to go guys! I really appreciate it.
author: Michael O.

description: We were super excited to try their breakfast pizza and bottomless mimosas. Unfortunately, they don't offer either anymore. Not a huge deal if the guy behind the counter would have cared about the customer.  When we asked for their breakfast pizza and mimosas, he simply said "yeah, our site is outdated." No concern that we came there for that or even an attempt to remedy the situation. With so many competitors with great customer service, I see no reason to return.
author: Kasey C.

description:
Definitely a great pizza, we added our own topping
Basil, red onion, meatballs, jalapeños, black olives. 
Everything was so delicious, that crust man was awesome, very good flavor awesome chill spot
author: Gilbert N.

description: I saw that they had chicken wings on the menu so I figure to tried it out and asked for them to  be cook more well done and they came out not cooked and were soggy... avellino should be ashamed... first and last I will order these soggy ass wings
author: Chanthasone K.

description:
This is the best pizza in SF. For sure! Like a great sauce to bread to cheese to toppings ratio. Anyway, check them out. They deserve your business! 

A few of my favorites are meat lovers pizza.
However I judge most pizza places on their pepperoni pizza. So check it out!
author: Chad I.

description:
Great pizza!  Tasty, crisp crust and delicious sauce and toppings.  My favorite is Italian sausage and mushroom.  The sausage is spicy with a little heat -- perfect.

I've only ordered delivery.  The over the phone customer service is friendly and very efficient.  Delivery is great.  My pizza arrives hot before or on the specified time.
author: Donna P.

description:
"Does it sound like I'm ordering a pizza?" -- Die Hard (1988)

The family and I were on our way to The Palace of Fine Arts to take on an escape room and we needed dinner beforehand. Thanks to my fellow Yelpers, I found PA and it was on the way and had a great rating. First negative was the lack of parking - luckily we found a couple of spaces on the streets somewhat close by, but even that was a challenge.

There is not much on the way of seating inside, but we were lucky and were there at an early enough time that we found a spot for all six of us. We all ordered individual slices (a family of 6 and of course we all have different tastes). Most of us ordered 2 slices each, but they were huge NY-style slices and some of us could have probably split a second slice between us.

They have a great variety of toppings and that certainly made it tought for me to decide on what I wanted for my slices. I opted for Pepperoni, garlic and black olives and an Arugula and Italian sausage. I had wanted bacon, but they happened to be out, so I opted for sausage. Both were great - I would classify the crust as a bit doughy, but delicious. There was a good amount of sauce and cheese without being greasy. I was quite happy with the slices and would definitely come back again.

They have free ice water on tap with cups, so if you are not a soda drinking, like myself, it was perfect. We were in and out in a short amount of time and to our escape room in plenty of time to meet the rest of our party. This place is not fancy and I love that - staff was friendly and I would recommend PA if you enjoy NY slices. A definite place to return to.
author: Lindy F.

description: This place is a tiny sit down restaurant on the street corner. They have pretty good New York style pizza for a reasonable price. I actually thought it was a bit more expensive than other New York style pizza places in SF (i.e. The Pizza Shop in the Mission). Their cheese pizzas are $4 while is more expensive than some other types places I've had and 50 cents for each topping. I've digressed, the pizza itself had a crispy crust and had the right amount of cheese and tomato sauce that made it just right.
author: Christopher L.

description: Pizzeria Avellino is a solid pizza spot. Close to my apartment with big, delicious slices. I also love their garlic bread. More important than the pizza flavor, they have quality and kind people working there. The other night, I dove into Avellino's when a crazy guy started following me. Even though they were closing up for the night after a long day of working, they waiting for my ride to come. The cherry on top was they gave me a slice of pizza for free. In a city where storefronts​ change constantly, Avellino's proves to be a business that cares about the community and always serves delicious pizza. SUPPORT THE GOOD GUYS AND EAT PIZZA!
author: Ashley B.

description: I really don't like pizza and what's sad is I like this pizza. I stop by here from time to time before I catch my bus and today seemed like a good time to do it. Well, somebody screwed up and lost my order. I missed my bus twice when the kid working the counter came to me and asked what I ordered. I told him and he returned about five minutes later to tell me the chef lost my order. No apology, no refund, nothing. Not given a time frame or a solution to correct their error, I let him know this caused me to miss my bus twice and I wasn't going to miss my bus a 3rd time. It's not rocket science and it shouldn't take 45 plus minutes to make 1 slice of pepperoni pizza. I told him to give my slice away because I wasn't missing a 3rd bus. Again, no apology but he happily kept my money and probably never gave my slice away. The management will be hearing from me on my next commute home.
author: Diana S.

description: Super disappointed. I was really looking forward to trying this place as they talk a big talk about real NYC pizza. However, this is pizza is super bland. To me, tomato sauce and crust make a pizza and both of these are super bland here. Sauce more sweet than spicy and crust pretty flavorless. I was really hoping this would satiate my thin crust NY-style pizza craving but alas is was very below average.
author: Jim T.

description: This place is the best New York pizza in SF. I stop here on my way to work all the time. The last time I was there the guy taking my order told me "it was Under new ownership" They did not only improve the pizza but made the place look very welcoming. The thin crust and the love they put into the pizza is like no other. Stop by and try pizza Avellino and you won't be disappointed
author: Fady A.

description:
This is hands down the top spot for a slice in SF - way better than Arinell in my opinion. The slices are thin with the perfect crunch, and the cheese/sauce balance is on point. 

Parking is actually not too bad around the corner, and service is quick so you won't be waiting too long anyways. Highly recommended if you're in the area!
author: Akshay V.

description: I have been a customer of Pizza Avellino for years.  I often have my pizza delivered to my home.  Tonight I called to place my order and was treated very poorly.  The man that answered the phone was not only rude to me but hung up on me.  He asked me for my phone number..which I gave him..he apparently didn't understand me and said"that's not how it works" with a sarcastic tone.  I don't appreciate being spoken to like that when I'm placing a food order!  I started to tell him and he hung up.  I'm appalled..needless to say I will take my business elsewhere.  There's plenty of pizza restaurants in the Marina.  And quite frankly their pizza isn't that good!
author: Cathy M.

description: Never disappointed, today was so good, one huge slice was not enough.  Today I ordered a mushroom slice that was pretty ex eptional. Prices are pretty reasonable as well.
author: Monica F.

description: Legit East Coast thin slice pizza. Delicious and I love that they give you the option to buy by the slice
author: Mary M.

description:
I love getting NY style pizza by the slice, and my go-to place is Arinell in Berkeley and in the Mission. However, Avellino makes excellent NY slices - very similar to Arinell, but with a bit more cheese, slightly doughier crust, and just a touch more sauce. The custom slices actually come out a bit better than Arinell - I usually get a sausage slice, and it's very satisfying.

The crust is thin and slightly crispy, and folds perfectly down the center so you can fold your pizza in half and eat it. The cheese blends perfectly with the sauce and the slices are heated up nice and hot enough to burn the roof of your mouth.
author: Allen T.

description:
Very good pizza. Easy parking and very fast service. I work from home and like to get out for lunch when possible. but when I get out, it must be fast,  no screwing around.  this pizzeria fits the profile. will be back soon to try the chicken park sandwich, which is supposed to be great. 

I am craving pizza now...LOL
author: Allan B.

description: Wasn't sure what to expect, the place didn't look the most appealing from outside through the windows. Glad we went in. Ordered meatball sub and some pizza and it didn't disappoint. We were a little disappointed the deep dish was sold out, but I can only imagine it is because it is so popular. Great divey place near our hotel (Inn at Golden Gate).
author: Edwin R.

description: Delicious pizzas!! I had the Lombard and it didn't disappoint! Generous slices and nice thin crust with fresh toppings. Caprese salad was just sliced mozzarella and sliced tomatoes which was very simple and small but still delicious with a basil pesto on the side. Definitely recommend this place. Great NY vibe and photos on the wall with a nice local vibe.
author: Brooke B.

description: Good NY style pie at a decent SF price, outdoor patio is awesome when the weather is right
author: Daniel P.

description:
We stopped by here upon visiting for the weekend. Sadly was not impressed. The customer service is lacking, the tables were filthy with trash, the pizza was dripping with grease and lacked flavor. 

We were really hoping based on other reviews it would be great authentic NY pizza and it was unfortunately not.
author: Janaye J.

description:
It's a must try pizzeria place here in Presidio in my opinion.  We first stumble upon this place on an accident looking for another restaurant that had already closed down (we didn't know), we were so hungry and tired after walking uphills and downhills exploring  San Francisco and admiring the beauty of Palace of Fine Arts.  There are other mom and pop stores nearby but I could not lift a foot anymore, Pizzeria Avellino conveniently sits in the corner of Lombard and Lyon Street, and is close to bus stops.  I'm glad we tried this place!  Its been my fave pizza place here in SF so far, and been coming here whenever I visit the city.   It's a great place for a taste of NY pizza, it's the closest to it that I have tried.  

I lalalalalalove it!
author: Freida G.

description: Another 5 star for my dear, Avellino. Thank you for existing amongst some shitty excuses for pizza places in SF. I heart you. Why do you have to be SO FREAKIN' FAR FROM ME?
author: Priti K.

description: Took my nephew there yesterday, a Saturday afternoon. We were celebrating his 9th birthday. I ordered a medium thin crust with full pineapple, half bacon (for my nephew), and half jalapeño (I'm a vegetarian). We sat outside, the sun was shining on us in just right way, and 15 or so minutes later our pizza arrives! It's full pineapple, half bacon, and half pepperoni. When it's dropped off, I repeat my order and add in that I haven't had meat in years. The incorrect half was taken back inside, the pepperoni slices removed, and cold jalapeños are placed on top. I asked if they removed the pepperoni and just put jalapeños on, because bits of cheese were missing as well, and it had looked "picked on". My assumption was confirmed, and I had to explain that just because the meat was removed doesn't make this half a vegetarian half. The grease and remnants of the pepperoni were still present. I walked inside, leaving my nephew to enjoy his half, which he devoured! I asked for a half refund, although I was extremely hungry, at this point I would have picked up a salad or a smoothie from some other location. One of the chefs suggested that instead of a refund they would put pineapple and jalapeños on top of pre-made cheese slices. I was quite hungry so I agreed. Back outside I went to be with my nephew, and about 3-5 minutes later my pizza arrives. It was no where near as appealing as my nephews', for on his everything was baked together, all golden brown, but mine was simply placed on top. So when I went to take a bite, most of the pineapple and jalapeños fell off, and the toppings were cold... We we not checked on after that, and I couldn't help but to be disappointed. But I ate a slice of this cold pizza just to have something in my stomach. I went inside to get a to go box for my nephew and I and let Jacob, at the front counter, know that half of our experience had been delightful and the other half quite disappointing. He apologized and brought me a glass of red wine. That was appreciated. I still recommend this pizza place, just have them repeat back your order before paying $25+ for a pizza.
author: Miia W.

description: Went in for a slice today before work..Slices of the day were great with friendly service from the chefs. Cant wait to go back!!
author: Eric S.

description: Yummy yummy yummy! We were hungry, and the more touristy areas were busy last night. My brother found this place online. Simple, greasy and yummy pepperoni pizza! Reminded us of being little kids, eating pizza for one of the first times. The crust was special, with just the right amount of black on the bottom for flavor (not burnt). We will be back, although the ride to get here is very long. Just loved the location and food. BF said meatball sub was also good! Thanks for making yummy food in a nice little neighborhood. How cool that we visited the Palace of Fine Arts nearby right after eating pizza at night. Gorgeous neighborhood and yummy food...an authentic SF experience!! Thanks
author: Marty C.

description:
The pizza are really good but $5 for a slice of cheese... 

It's not worth it.  Unless you're starving to death you can find cheaper for as good.
author: Théo N.

description: Wow!  Can't believe I didn't find this place sooner.  If you're looking for a solid NY slice, I don't know of a better place in SF.  Crispy crust and wonderful ingredients.  Can't wait to try out the rest of the menu (the meatballs looked delicious and the Chicken Pesto Pizza sounded amazing as well).
author: Tyler B.

description: Really is like a New York slice in San Francisco! I can even fold it to eat it, which makes me love it even more. Always super friendly and a great outdoor patio. Have to grab a slice here whenever I'm in the neighborhood!
author: Chris O.

description:
Stumbled upon Avellino while walking around the Pac Heights neighborhood.  Wasn't searching for pizza but just a quick bite to eat.  PA is a no frills, straight down to business NY style pizzeria.  It's a small space with table seating for about 20 and bar seating against the wall for about another 6 people.  There are some picnic tables outside as well.  The menu is simple - pizza by the pie or by the slice and a few salad and pasta choices.  

I've always been a fan of thin crust and NY pizza, so I didn't think we could go wrong here.  Other half and I walked in for a late lunch.  There was only another family of 8 dining in there.  Got to the counter and ordered a slice each.  The slices start at $3.70 for cheese only and each topping is $0.50.  I went with one of my favorites - mushroom.  Other half got bacon and pepperoni.  Serve yourself water dispenser and pick up your own utensils were by the chalk board menu wall.  

Within minutes, our slices were brought out piping hot to our table.  The slices were huge and more than enough to satisfy our appetites.  I liked that the mushrooms were thickly sliced.  The pizza was simple yet just what the doctor ordered.  Nice crunchy thin crust with basic marinara and cheese.  Happy to find this place and would stop by again if I was in the neighborhood.  Service was fine.  Great neighborhood spot!
author: Liv A.

description: What a little treat that I was so fortunate to stumble upon.  It is a hidden treasure and was so happy that I have finally found my go to Pizza Spot in San Francisco.  Living in New York, I never thought that I would ever find slices made to order with the same quality that I had on the east coast.  I had nothing to lose, so I placed my order.  From the first to the last bite I felt like I was back home.  Atmosphere is awesome with a little patio outside so that my best friend(my dog) can come with me and enjoy what I think is the best New York pizza here in San Fran.  Highly recommend this place if you wanted to sit down or just to grab on the go! You won't be disappointed.
author: Kevin L.

description: Awesome little pizza place walking distance from Travelodge.  We are here on vacation touring San Francisco and we wanted a good pizza without having to drive so we walked here and the pizza was excellent!  I would definitely come back here often if I lived in the area!
author: Elias B.

description: It's been years since I've had NY style pizza by the slice and this place hit the spot. The price is right... $4 for a cheese slice plus $0.50 per topping. The slices are huge and 1 is plenty for a meal. They're generous with the toppings and service is fast and friendly. I just wish they were open later as we came back from a concert at 1am and had another craving!
author: Suzanne Q.

description: I was heading up to the Presidio and needed is quick bite. My nose led me here to this non descript pizza point. It had a patio and the pizza smelled great. I had ordered the daily special and it was only $5.00. It was called the Sicilian special and it was Ginormous. I wanted a beer but they didn't have any, but the gentleman suggested that I can go to the liquor store next door and grab a cold one and bring it back. The place is small but I noticed a lot of patrons got their orders to go.  I also noticed that one of their Special pizza had Ham, Jalapeños, and Pineapples!! That is definitely on my bucket list and I must go back there to try it.
author: Robert R.

description: Pizzeria Avellino is one of my top 5 favorite pizza joints in the Bay Area.  I grew up in NY/NJ for 20 years and Avellino's is the closest I've found to traditional NY style pizza.  Nice, chewy crust, and the optimal ratio of crust-sauce-cheese.  This is the nostalgic slice for you if you're longing for NY style. My go-to is the large cheese pie, but their meatball sub and chopped salad are great too.  Online ordering for pickup and delivery is convenient, and there's a small seating area inside.  You can also walk right across the street to the Presidio and enjoy your slice on a picnic bench.
author: Jules P.

description: Our 1 star review is not necessarily based on the quality of the Pizza, this rating is based on the service. We ordered a cheese pizza and a Lombard pizza with extra meatballs through Eat24. The order came pretty quickly but the Lombard pizza had been substituted with a simple one topping cheese and Meatball pizza (no extra meatballs). The driver offered to bring the right one and we agreed, but that order never arrived. We called 10 minutes before they closed to see where the hell it was. But they said the ovens were off and it was too late. The defensive and argumentative employee on the phone claimed they tried to call us several times, but they were calling Eat24 not our number, even though our phone number was clearly shown on the emailed receipt. We did not enjoying getting either the wrong pizza (Nine bucks cheaper than the one we wanted) and the rude argumentative employee on the phone. Do not order delivery from these people if you want the right order, their customer service sucks! Not ordering from this place again!
author: Darin H.

description:
The pizza looked delicious and tasted ok when we ate it.. But a few hours after my boyfriend and I were so thirsty and felt dehydrated! I don't know what they put in their pizzas but the after effect of eating it really put me off from this place.
I don't know if there was MSG or just a crap ton of salt, but I  definitely will not go back to figure it out.
author: Camille B.

description: One of the best NY style pizza in the city! You can make your own and add toppings even if it's just for a slice, which is a great option. The ingredients were super fresh and made our lunch such a treat!
author: Prashanth V.

description:
Visiting from San Diego & we stayed at the Travelodge next door. What a treat! Stumbled by this gem when we were headed to Presidio Park to use the bathroom at Starbucks.
Stayed in SF for 4 nights (had an early fancy shmancy dinner in Chinatown) and STILL ate some Avellino's Pizza this night too. We were never disappointed. Even had the last piece of Sicilian Style Deep Dish slice. NOT the Chicago style deep dish either. 
The guys who worked there were really cool & engaged in conversation. TV wqas always on. Either watching the Giants or South Park. Which was really cool! LOL
I always thought the prices were fair. And I just noticed how one of the other photos for this business had a sign that said Thank You Veterans! Free Cheese Slice w/ valid Military ID. How awesome is that?! I love our military heroes & am a proud daughter of a sailor. And I love ANY business that supports our military.
I highly recommend Pizzeria Avellino!
author: Joanne P.

description:
Traveling from San Diego and found this place on Google.  So glad we did. Some of the best tasting pizza I've ever had. 

Thank you.
author: Jessica R.

description: Great pizza. Good price. Small, neighborhood spot with a nice vibe.
author: Stefanie R.

description:
Oh. My. God.

     This place has seriously delicious pizza. We're on vaca from Temecula, ca. And didn't REALLY know where to eat. This place is awesome! Off the beaten path. Service is incredible. Such friendly people and an outside patio that is warm and inviting. We are having a nice vacation. We'll go back to some places when we return. 

We will definitely come back here!
author: Donald L.

description:
Really good cheap pizza by the slice. They've got pizza of the day (two topping meat and a vegetarian option) and a couple of salad options... Less than $4 for a big slice? OK! I stopped in to eat (was recommended) before meeting a friend and touring Industrial Lighting and Magic, which is literally across the street. They have seats inside and outside. Outside seating is nice for when it's sunny and warm. 

You can also customize your own pizza, which is typically the case with most places.

Quick service. Polite too. Beats any fast food joint any day.
author: Alanna M.

description: I lived in New York City for many years before moving to SF and I can say this is excellent pizza that tastes just like a New York slice. I'm only docking 1 star for the price, which is definitely a significant premium to any slice place in New York I've ever been to
author: Nitesh Y.

description: Place is way better than I thought. I am a New Yorker so I have some standards for pizza. These guys did a great job will definitely grab a slice here again.
author: Mike S.

description: Pizza was great! Had the sweet heat -pineapple, bacon and jalepenos. Also got a large cheese. The med and large are almost the same size. Our group sat outside and enjoyed beers and sunshine! Good vibes at this place.
author: Cierra H.

description: I live in the neighborhood and value Avellino as a true New York style pie. In fact, if they were open right now I would grab a slice.
author: S B.

description:
Great pizza SF, slices are huge which I didn't know or I'd have just paid per slice not bought a whole pizza, but it was still delish! We were starving after 6 hours of nonstop driving so this pizza hit the spot. I got simple pepperoni and my friend got cheese & her daughter got a meatball sub. I tasted everything as I must always & it was all yummy, although I'd like the pizza crust a little crunchy but that's just my preference.

I took away one star because the guy at the counter was not friendly at all. He wasn't rude but clearly not approachable either. Maybe he didn't like that we were tourists? A smile would do him some good.
author: Lachelle I.

description: Great pizza, friendly staff. We ordered 30 pizzas from them for a holiday party, and everyone loved their pizza. Professional staff, quality pizza, and very well priced.
author: A B.

description: It's a small spot in SF with a quaint atmosphere and a generally comfortable environment. However, the pizza is bland. Most of the flavor came from just average pepperoni and the pizza itself was incredibly greasy to the point where I found it unsettling. Additionally, the presentation was lackluster and looked less appetizing than a fast food pizza (which would probably taste better too). Overall, this tasteless, greasy mess is definitely not worth the price and I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Luigi R.

description: Solid ny style pizza, way better than all the other local pizza joints like orgasmica and marina pizza.
author: auclair k.

description: Hotties serving bomb pizza. The boys are sweet and the pizza is sooo delicious, definitely better than anything on the warf!
author: Angel L.

description:
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
  IMPORTANT - UNDER NEW OWNERSHIP
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
Ugh. I feel sad and betrayed. Why? Because I just lost my favorite NY-style slice pizza joint in San Francisco. Avellino seems to have been sold to, let's just say, non-NYers. The former owners appear to have stripped this place right down to the paint, and along with it, its NY soul. Gone is the NY-inspired pizza. Gone is all the cool NY-inspired art and especially photographs. Gone is the long NY-style counter with shakers of oregano, chili flakes, and parmesan cheese. Even the menus above the cash register are gone, replaced with hand-written paper signs haphazardly taped to the wall. I don't know who the new owners are and I don't know why they believe they know how to tap into the NY pizza getstalt, but I can say that my most recent (and now, last ever) slice was overheated and burnt, with too much cheese and too little flavor. Sad.
author: Richard A.

description: Good za! Value pricing! Limited seating but a great locale at Lombard gate. Try it and become a fan.
author: Oscar C.

description: This place is the best pizza in SF and it's not even close. Stands up the the best in New York for sure.
author: Garrett F.

description: Always delicious thin crust pizza and courteous service! It's hard to get pizza like this in sf.
author: V J.

description:
This place is solid and dependable and good. The people that mark it lower probably are from the Marina and think, "It really doesn't have enough TVs." Or "The women that come here aren't as hot as the Bus Stop." They should stick with Paxti's and not crowd up the place for people with real tastes.

Also - the people are super cool, I'm sure the ones that think otherwise want to be fawned over by a waiter. It's pizza. Hand held. Take it and eat it and that's it.
author: Jeff W.

description: Great local fav! Went in for a slice of classic NY style thin and ended up with that and the Sicilian square cut deep dish on special. Will absolutely be back for more of both!
author: Kristen R.

description: Great food!! The customer service was spot on as well! My dance group (~20 people) stopped in to eat something quick and they were more than helpful to accommodate.
author: Candace A.

description:
5 stars for the pizza, 1 for the service. 
This is legit the only NY style pizza I've found in SF. Big slices, perfect cheese/sauce ratio, everything your looking for. However, the service or lack there of is atrocious! Every time we call for a delivery, they don't have anyone available to bring it to us. When we go to pick it up they tell us it will be ready in 20 min, but it takes 40. Lastly, tonight @ 9:35pm I came by to get a few slices and the gentleman working told me all they have available are salads and sandwiches. No more pizza. What?! You're a pizza place that serves slices...on top of that, the guys working were staking chairs on tables. They clearly didn't want to work anymore. Do the owners know about this behavior?! I'd love a response...
author: Crystal I.

description:
New Yorker here. Born and raised.

'X' out of your browser and close your laptop. If you're on your phone, stop scrolling down and hit 'get directions.' In other words, go here. 

This is the closest to a NY slice we've found in the city. All the other pizza spots are just noise. Why?

The texture of the cheese = on point. 
The consistency and texture of the dough = nailed it.
The flavor and amount of tomato sauce on our pie = just perfect.
The SMELL of the place when you walk in = unreal. Close your eyes and you'll feel like you're in NYC.
The guys behind the counter = awesome.

AND, as a bonus: YOU CAN FOLD THE PIZZAS TO CAPTURE ALL THE GREASE.

I really wish I didn't live in Potrero Hill... it's so far from Avellino. But I guess that's also a good thing, otherwise I'd be here every single day.
author: Tik P.

description: My new favorite pizza place in the Marina. I've eaten a lot of pizza, and at every location in the Marina and Cow Hollow, and this is now a winner for the NY style set. Consistent quality and quick preparation.
author: Matthew v.

description: The ambiance was great staff was super cool. The garlic cheesy bread was super awesome but the pizza was just ok.
author: John R.

description:
For a pepperoni pizza overflowing with pools of oil, I was pleasantly surprised when I took a bite out of the heart-attack-inducing, artery clogging critter. It was bigger than my head for $4. I soaked through 3 full sheets of napkins, and it was still leaking! Fortunately for it, it was mighty tasty so I finished it entirely and felt full for hours.

The menu was...different. I'm not a huge pizza fan, so the only time I'll have it is if I'm feeling lazy and it's a Pizza Hut/Domino's kind of day; Pizzeria Avellino offers something homelier, and it felt like the real deal. Extensive and creative menu (http://pizzeriaavellino.com/menus.htm). The slice of the day when we visited sounded like a breakfast burrito...on a pizza crust! My friend really loved hers even though her palette was confused by the combination at first. Mine was equally and confusingly good as well. Thin, crunchy crust. Flavorful sauce. The pepperonis were small, but they were delicious (flavor and texture was on point; crisped up on the edges) and the ratio was perfect. Cheese was melty, gooey, and stretchy.

The cashiers were friendly! Space was limited though, but it wasn't busy that Saturday morning. The benches were littered with bits and pieces of food, so it was a little unnerving to sit there; I also noticed the covers on the tables had leftover sauce on them because it ended up on my white sleeves. So if you dine here, be careful where you sit and be ready to enjoy some real good pizza! 

We were recommended this joint by our inn's check-in clerk, and so it seems like a good local spot to grab a quick bite to eat.
author: Ivy W.

description: Great pizza period! And you can go next door to Golden gate market and buy beer and wine and bring it in with you while you enjoy your pizza!! Outstanding!
author: Juicy M.

description: Ordered the Medium Lombard pizza and can say with thriving confidence that it was one of the worst pizzas I have ever had - stale crust, stale pepperoni and sausage. I lived half my life in Chicago so I know a thing or two about pizza but this was just pitiful. Maybe they were having a bad day but that's my only point of reference. Definitely not eating here, ordering or recommending this place to anyone!
author: Kabir S.

description: Finally solved the delivery issue! I can't wait to get Avellino when the craving hits!
author: Kim K.

description:
If you want to charge $0.25 for a carry out box for slices that's fine, I'm ok with it, really! But don't put up a sign saying you are doing it to discourage use and save the environment! If I buy 2 slices to go I need a box, that's just the way it is. Just build the cost into the price don't blame a lame attempt to save the planet as your reasoning. I understand you pay for the box and I'm fine with paying for it too!

The pizza was good although every time I was there they only had cheese but would add whatever topping you wanted upon reheating. That never works as the topping just fall off.
author: Randy C.

description: Best slice I have found in nearly the entire city of San Francisco.
author: Slob M.

description: Yummy pizza by the slice option. They have a cute little outdoor seating area that is gated off of the sidewalk. Quick service and good prices.
author: KF B.

description: It's great pizza by slice and definitely worth the 15 minute trip. I dig the casual atmosphere and the service is alway quick a attentive.
author: Alexander M.

description:
Love the pizza and I come from a family that has owned a pizzeria in LA since 64.
Only concern is the young lady behind the counter need to put her hair back.
Long hair and pizza don't mix...health dept violation.
author: Hip P.

description: Boyfriend got two cheese slices and I ordered 2 slices of pepperoni. A little greasy but it was absolutely delicious. Staff was friendly and brought out the pizza for me since we were eating outside with our dog. A little bit pricey but was delicious. Inside it was small and quaint pretty clean as well.
author: Christine V.

description:
Your basic corner neighborhood pizza joint. They make the greasy fold over NY style slices -and though I would have normally said yuck, yuck not for me, I gobbled ever delicious bite.

Decent basic Caesar to accompany. No wine (though it's offered they were out of all whites) and a decent beer selection.

The dining area is small with picnic benches outside for warmer times.

All in all a decent pizza joint and worth a stop if you live or hotel in the neighborhood - we took ours to go but the place was decent enough to hang out.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
For starts I have been sick all day after eating their meatball sandwich so, working in the food industry myself, I assume the food was mishandled in some sort of way-not clean hands or leaving out being refrigerated too long.

Over priced, for a 5 inch sub it was 10 dollars. It was mediocre, no bad, but just not worth 10 dollars. 6 at best. 

The staff was friendly but took a long time to actually get my food given that knows 1 of 3 customers.

Won't be going back.
author: Gabriela F.

description: The pizza here was really great and seeing as how I was paying a visit to the Palace of Fine Arts it was a great little find. The pizzas are a bit larger than other pizza places so the cashier made sure it was alright before putting the order in. The cheese bread was also really interesting because it was just a small pizza with cheese on it. It was definitely fun to eat though.
author: Philip M.

description: Just got delivery from here via PrimeNow Restaurants - AWESOME. I haven't even finished my first piece and decided to write this review. It only took 45 and the pizza is literally perfect. New favorite.
author: Neeti C.

description:
The best pizza I had here in SF since I move 6 months ago. And I tried a lot of different place. They really deserve a better grade specially for a specially cheap price. Will come again for sure !!

Plus there are really nice.
author: Angélique Y.

description:
I'm torn when it comes to this review. I've always enjoyed the pizza huge and cheesy with crunchy crust just how I like. But. The service. Wow. I'm not sure who the boss is since he's never around but the employees are left to "run" the business however they want which leads to a complete lack of concern for the customer. I have 2 options basically: 1) come when the chubby guy who makes awesome pizza is there and deal with the awful service or 2) come when the other guy is there and get /ok/ service but terrible square-shaped pizza. It's a weird catch-22. 

Might as well get a sandwich next door. :/
author: Ligia J.

description:
A trip to the city has us looking for a late bite close to where we were stressing in the marina district. Within walking distance we find this great little hidden gem. A small out of the way pizzeria at the end of Lombard St. with true thin crust new york  style pizza. 

Counter service only to order and for to go. Order, grab a seat and a beer or glass of wine. Fresh, hot and traditional style pizzeria. 

Great Giants baseball memorabilia and an electric mix of 1970's album covers cover the walls make for interesting decor and viewing while you dine and drink. 

You can order by the slice or a whole pie, and this cool little joint also offers a Sunday brunch pizza.

Personable friendly service and cheap pizza, with a few beer and wine selections available. Well worth the stop.

00003
author: Ray F.

description:
nice tourist trap they got there...I ordered a slice of Italian sausage/black olives and they sure came from a can, no flavors at $5!
the only good part was the A/C outlet to charge my phone.
author: Scott L.

description: Things seem to be moving in the right direction.  Pizza is absolutely the best NY Pizza in SF and they finally seem to have a delivery driver, as the last 3 times we have called, there haven't been any issues
author: Andrew K.

description:
Walked the Golden Gate Bridge and built up an appetite. 
Ate here with my teenage boys. They loved it.
Friendly service as well.
author: Craig F.

description: Three stars is somewhat ironic, because it was either tasty (4 stars) or weirdly crappy (2 stars).  I think the rating overall is just too high, and probably reflects this is the only pizza option on the presidio side of Lombard/Richardson
author: Steve S.

description: Great service and great pizza! Perfect neighborhood pizzeria! The Lombard was delicious! They were very accommodating and allowed us to grab a beer next door to enjoy with our pizza!
author: Dacy R.

description:
This little corner spot offers pizza by the slice which is so hard to find in SF! The pizza starts out as a basic thin crust cheese (you can also choose the deep dish sicilian variety) and then you specify any number of toppings (selection includes pepperoni, fresh tomatoes, arugula, mushrooms.). The slice is topped with your choice of toppings and then quick-fired in the oven so that it's piping hot. It's called out or brought to you. Each slice is large (just under/about the size of a paper plate) and will ring in at about $3.50 + pay per topping.

It's not quite like NY dollar pizza (the cheap slices off the street), which have a flexible crust that you can fold over -- this one has a very crisp bottom. Each slice is also fired to order until bubbling hot, unlike in NY where the pizzas are sitting out all day and reheated for a quick minute. Lastly the edge crust is full and risen, whereas in New York it tends to be flat and bready. In any case, this pizza is still very delicious in its own right. :) Sauce is flavorful, crust is crispy on the bottom with a good chew, and the cheese is a modest amount -- a perfect ratio.

There's a small amount of seating inside (~20 seats plus wall area with bar stools) and some picnic tables and benches outside as well.

Overall excellent and one of my favorite thin crust slices in SF!
author: Jennie W.

description: Recently ate here after a walk around the Palace of Fine Arts. Pizza was sub par to say the least. Here comes the fun part... my father and I both had food poisoning the same night after we came home. I don't know what they're doing at this pizza joint, but eat here at your own risk. I would give it a half star to no stars if it was an option.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Great pizza and cheese bread!  You can special order each slice of pizza!  The crust is perfect...just slightly crisp on the bottom,
Not too thick, tasty and generally awesome!  The garlic cheese bread was delicious also. Can't wait to go back. Friendly service, great neighborhood atmosphere and terrific food!
author: G M.

description:
Surprised they don't have higher ratings! Delicious NY style pizza! 
After coming back from NY, I was depressed because of the shortage of NY pizza here. One day I came across Avellino's and was overjoyed. 

They also do pizza by the slice! Super convenient. 
Theres a bench outside so you can drink a beer and bring your pup.
author: Dee N.

description:
I've been here a few times. The breakfast pizza is delicious. I think the veggie is better than the one with meat. It has much more flavor. I also tried the Nutella dessert for breakfast...whoops. But so tasty. No regrets. I want to try and see if I can make that at home as a little treat! 

Also one mimosa is $8 or bottomless mimosas for $8...pretty easy choice!
author: F T.

description: Oh pizza. I love pizza. I would eat it everyday if I could, but it's unhealthy. This place is a simple pizza place located in the Marina near the Presidio. I got mushroom. The crust is good and sturdy. It was a pizza recipe without frills and I would eat it again. Good service.
author: Denise C.

description: Real New York pizza. If you have always wanted to try pizza from nyc or miss it from back home, go here. The guys are from ny. A little pricy at $4/slice but worth it.
author: caleb d.

description: I couldn't be happier. I came in for something healthy-ish and got an AWESOME chopped salad with bacon, olives and mozzarella. It was a good sized bowl that filled me up (I'm 6'3" and about 245lbs). Plus it's BYOB! LOVE IT!  I've been in for pizza too and that's a good call too. Well done!
author: Joe S.

description: Pizza is great! Parking is hard to find, but it's SF so that's expected. The service is terrible though!!! They are awkward, and not friendly.
author: JC C.

description:
So delicious. The pizza here is great, albeit very greasy...but that just adds to the flavor :) I come here fairly regularly for lunch, and the staff is always friendly and the service is great. I've never ordered a whole pizza, but the individual slices come pretty quickly and are huge! I've also been here for brunch on the weekends, and their $8 bottomless mimosas are fantastic.

It is always VERY hot in there - do just be aware that you may want to sit outside on a warm day!
author: Aly G.

description: Their quality has gone down the tubes or burnt up in the oven.  Worst meal I've had.  Pizza was raw in places and burnt in others.  The sanitation is disgusting.  We could not eat 80% of our meal because we watched them rinse used dishes and silverware with no soap and give it for people to use.
author: MA C.

description: Great dance floor! Fantastic pizza and wonderful service, too.
author: Emma C.

description:
As a Chicagoan, I believe in the Church of Thick Cheese and Robust Sauce.  As a visitor to San Francisco, it's gonna be hard for me to convert to thin, virtually sauce-less pizza.

Pizzeria Avellino is a tiny little restaurant with a limited menu.  You can either get slices or an entire pie, but don't expect to order small, medium or large.  They come in one size, depending on the style you get.

I took a shot at the formaggio (four-cheese) napolitana style.  I sampled the first slice without alteration.  It was... good-ish.  It had such a slight flavor that as I continued chewing through the pie, I found myself dousing it with increasing amounts of powdered garlic, parmesan and red pepper.  I was disappointed by the lack of any substantial sauce.  It tasted less like pizza and more like flatbread with a thin cheese layer.

As I ate it, I couldn't help but thinking this was the kind of pizza girls would love.  It's light, it's not terribly flavorful.  It's the pizza equivalent of salad.  Maybe you'd hit this kind of place for lunch, but not to satisfy a monstrous hunger.

Two things were a bit odd about the restaurant...

1) As I walked in, they were playing Rage Against The Machine over the speakers.  Awesome, sure, but it didn't quite fit their aesthetic.

2) I asked for a cup of ice water.  "We don't have ice," the guy said, "but the water will be cold."  Ooookay?

Perhaps their NY style pizza would be more up my alley.  I didn't hate Pizzeria Avellino, but I didn't love it, either.
author: Ben B.

description:
I came to Pizzeria Avellino just to grab a quick meal to go in a place that actually had a bathroom! (Many nearby stores and restaurants pointed me this way when I asked for their bathrooms.) 

I was willing to pay just to use the bathroom, but I also got a yummy meatball sub too! The prices may seem high, but the portions are quite filling. I expressed my concern over how much cheese would be in the sub since I'm not the hugest fan, and they seemed to accommodate my request. The house-made meatballs were indeed a highlight for me, so I'm glad they recommended that. They also had outlets in the restaurant and ample seating. My only issue was that my friend and I waited way longer than anticipated for our orders...
author: Kimberly Y.

description:
This place is a joke. I called and ordered a large pineapple for pick up. I repeated pineapple multiple times, and even made sure the Pizzeria Avellino representative said pineapple back.

I arrive to pick up my pizza, and they made me a pepperoni! Honestly, how could someone be SO stupid, that they can't even get a simple order right? Large pineapple. Two words.

I won't be coming here ever again.
author: John D.

description:
We had a medium cheese pizza and it was pretty tasty. My guy is from the east coast and is very picky about his pizza, but he seemed to enjoy it. Not a lot of seating indoors, and no fountain drinks. Pricing was ok- $23 for our pizza, two waters and a bottled iced tea.

They seemed pretty busy with people ordering by the slice, so probably a good place to stop for a quick lunch
author: Angelica S.

description:
This is an entirely decent pizza slice - thin crust, tangy sauce, not too much cheese, not expensive.  
I'd give it a fifth star is the crust had a bit more chewiness and not just crunch.
author: Jaina S.

description: This pizza is not very good. I like the spices they use, but it was soggy, and the sauce tastes way too sweet. I would go elsewhere if you want something good to sink your teeth into, because the pizza is also pretty thin.
author: Evanthia K.

description: Awesome Pizza, awesome service! We are definitely coming back!!! We ordered a large pizza and ended up wanting more (due to a bigger appetite than realized).
author: Helen L.

description: The pizza is pretty good and the slices are really big. The only reason they aren't getting 5 stars is because I found a hair on my food.
author: Alejandra L.

description: Small hole in the wall restaurant with great pizza by the slices! Fast, efficient service! Place to sit outside too! Right by Presidio, and close to UHS
author: TK L.

description: Longtime customers addressing the owner Gil about your employee David (working evening on 6/25) about his lack of attention, dishonesty, and disrespect towards your customers. TWO times in one week called in a to-go pie and showed up with no pie made/order not put in. What bothers me even more than being inconvenienced is that David tried to cover up for his errors by saying it would just be a few more minutes - a total insult when can see the pizza being prepared from scratch. The first time we swallowed it and brushed it off, giving David the benefit of the doubt because I get it, we all have bad days and things happen.  But to repeat it in a matter of days and for David to just throw his hands up and act like he doesn't give a damn about people or the business is just not right. Why work a job you don't like? Also I am leaving this review because David didn't provide me with any info to get in touch. There were also a few other issues with how the situation was addressed that I can discuss with you if you care to get in touch.
author: Kay A.

description:
Absolutely THE WORST PIZZA I ever ate! Soggy in the middle. Hard as burnt wood on the outside. Un-eatable!! 
When we asked him for a fork, he took one from the used utensils pile, quickly rinsed it in water, and gave it to us.
At least he could have wiped it under his arm pit! 
TOTALLY GROSS!!
author: Rich K.

description: Awesome good pizza for $4?!  Heck yeah!!   Plus really cool vintage signs and Killer classic rock music playing.  They don't serve beer but let us get some tall boys from the liquor store next door n bring it in; even gave us a bottle opener.  Thanks guys!  This place is cool, divey & chill.
author: Jaye V.

description: Perfect! Stopped in after a 7 mile walk. Totally hit the spot!  I want more!!
author: S. Y.

description:
I grew up and raised a family in New York.  I know a thing or two about NY style pizza.  We ordered two slices.  They were disappointing.  

First, the technique of pizza making:  The crust was very unevenly formed with the center of the pie paper thin.  It was so extremely thin that it could not hold itself up even with my hand propping it under the wax paper.  Eating this poorly formed pizza was an embarrassingly untidy chore.  The pizza maker was obviously a newbie and was not properly trained.  

Second, the pizza itself was lacking in flavor.  The crust was unlike NY pizza which has crispy outer skin with pleasantly chewy bread inside.  This pizza bread was just chewy.  The tomato sauce was flavorless and bland.  The cheese was reasonably good though.  The oregano on the table I sprinkled on the pizza was flavorless.  It was likely very old.

This place tries to be NY style pizza, but it fails.
author: Robert W.

description: My family and I were spending the day in the city and this place happened to be the closest place we could find (we were starving). It's a little cramped inside but the pizza is SO GOOD. It was the highlight of my day!
author: Stephanie C.

description: As a new yorker that has lived in LA and now SF this is by far the closest to proper NYC pizza I have ever had! I work right across from here and you best believe I go there at least once a week.
author: Jesse F.

description:
This is my favorite spot for Sunday brunch. Mimosas and breakfast pizzas are available only on Saturdays and Sundays.  $8 bottomless mimosas (use to be $5..DARN..but still a good deal)! Amazing breakfast pizzas ($20 for M and $25 for XL). A tiny TV, maybe 19''? but we were able to watch the entire niners game. 

There's a parking lot for a few cars but street parking is easily found too. 

Only wish the bathroom was more easily accessible. You have to go through the cashier to the back of the kitchen and the cashier has to keep opening the door to let you back there (or you can crawl under the gate). I felt a little annoying since I had to go every few minutes since my small bladder runs like a faucet with bottomless mimosas.
author: Victoria C.

description: This place is really convenient to the Presidio and a decent joint when you're craving a slice. Great crust, and pretty good sauce - not a fan of their sausage or pepperoni, or any of their toppings in general. There are much better slices in the city but this place is decent in a pinch.
author: Wayne H.

description:
Authentic NY style or not, I have no idea. The pizza was okay- very decent, but nothing so amazing or different that I'd be raving to my friends about it. 

The good news is that it's cheap - $24 for an extra large that may very well be the biggest pizza I've ever seen. They also have free delivery. 

The guy forgot our salad, and on his return trip, he threw in a bottle of Coke. Nice gesture, even though I don't drink soda.... 

Something weird- the phone number on their receipt actually connects to the wax museum at Fisherman's Wharf. That led to a very confusing conversation!
author: Joanne G.

description: New Yorkers, get a delicious slice of pizza, fold it, and walk thru the Presidio. Forgettaboutit!
author: Peter H.

description: Pretty much the real deal here. The crust is almost a little too thin around the edges but still a very good, authentic NY style slice. I will definitely be back for a slice with homemade meatballs.  Didn't try them this time as I always try out a new pizzeria with a plain slice. It passed the test for sure.
author: Jess G.

description: The pizza slices were large and filling. Great taste! The best were the blistered shishito peppers with lemon aioli!
author: Sharon S.

description:
Former New Yorker couple approved : D

My husband is the kind of guy that prefers NY style pizza over Italian style (and obviously over Pizza Hut, etc but that's a duh).  He is also the kind of guy that spent the first two years of college feeding on slices of pizza and ice cream in NY.  Lol.  I think I can technically claim that he is a pizza ho.

On the contrary, I like NY style pizzas okay, but prefer Italian style.  NY pizzas are tricky for me, as it can often involve fake cheese, lots of grease, and OD on salt.  So I'm pretty fussy when it comes to this type of pizza.

Well, who would've thought we'd find a pizza joint that actually serves pretty authentic NY style pizza AND we actually both like, in San Francisco?  We totally beat the odds with Pizzeria Avellino.

We had a coupon that we bought from one of those online local 1-day deal type websites.  We ordered a medium Lombard Combo pizza with caesar salad, 1 beer and 1 Java tea... the bill came out to be $30... with the coupon I had, we effectively only paid $15. Cha - ching! : D

The Lombard Combo pizza was a perfect amount of tomato sauce and cheese topped with pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms and black olives, on a think, crispy crust.  Served up piping hot.  We dined-in so we ate it at the freshest condition; ) Not super greasy like some American pizzas can be.  That and the crispyness won some points from me.

The staff there was friendly and cool, although they kinda forgot our ceasar salad and I had to ask for it.  It looked like they just pulled it out from their fridge where they keep all their bottled drinks, though, so now that I think about it I don't know if I was supposed to get it myself?  Then again I would still have to get the croutons and dressing from them.  Anyway, caesar was VERY cheesy.  basically loads of shaved cheese on top of lettuce, plus croutons and rich caesar  dressing.  I liked it but it was so rich, after half the pizza, I was already ODing on salt and couldn't finish up the salad alone.  Good thing my husband prefers to be less healthy lol! as he helped finish up the salad too.  

We also like that they are open until 10pm.  I tend to take evening dance classes in the city and often don't get out until 9pm, so finding places we can swing by after 9 in the city is very key and much appreciated.  Definitely wouldn't mind coming back the next time my hubby has a pizza craving! (which is pretty much every week haha)
author: Sascha O.

description:
Pizzeria Avellino was my first foray into NYC style thin crust pizza. We ordered an XL Lombard Special and on half subbed bell pepper for olives, no problem. This turned out to be a good choice in size because it gives you 8 huge slices and my friend and I ate 3 each. Also had a good porter beer with the pie. After ordering we checked out the British bar next door and it was old fashioned but decent. It had the game on but on mute. I'm partial to this pizza place because my cousin works there but it's a good place to check on the edge of the Marina there near the Presidio.

The decor is cool, loads of 70s-80s album covers on the walls, Giants championship gear, old SF stuff, clean and interesting design.

Looking at the menu, I look forward to giving the meatball sub a try and some of their hot sandwiches. I'm sure the salad is good too.
author: Marty J.

description:
5 close friends and I decided not to lose a great parking space at the Palace of Fine Arts and walked toward the Presidio. Tried to get in to a local place that refused to seat us ("sorry, no reservation, can't seat you") and walked around the corner to find this gem.

GREAT thin crust pizza! We had the veggie and the lombard combo. Thin, crispy crust with just the right amount of sauce and toppings. I don't usually eat pizza any more but I was SO glad I made the exception! FANTASTIC.

2 sizes: Medium and Extra Large. The medium is more like a large and the extra large was too much for 4 ravenous pizza eaters! even the leftovers were yummy.

Good service even when the place got full with a line that stretched out the door.

Big props to Pizzeria Avellino for having Palo Alto Fire Fighters Pepper Sauce on every table (my current favorite pepper sauce). It was a treat to find it there (awesome sauce AND all proceeds go to Charity!).

Soooooo, if you find yourself starving in or near the Presidio or you are a thin crust Pizza lover, head to Pizzeria Avellino...I can't imagine you will be disappointed.
author: Gary O.

description:
It's been a while since I've had a pizza from a place other than Costco. I walked down this neighborhood and it smelled pretty good from the outside so I thought I would give it a try.

I ordered a slice of pepperoni and a slice of sausage pizza. Both were around $4 per slice, but unfortunately neither slice really impressed me. The cheese and sauce were good, but the meat toppings felt like they were just thrown on top after the pizza had already been cooked. Most of the crust was pretty good, but on one of the slices it was slightly burnt. The slices are really large though, so at least you get your money's worth quantity wise.

The service is decent though, and at least I got to watch part of the Giants game while trying the pizza. I guess one more plus is that there is outdoor seating if you want to enjoy pizza outside on a nice day.
author: Allen C.

description:
I've only had one order so far. Four stars for taste--solid thin crust, good sauce/cheese ratio. They also delivered pretty quickly and the pizza was still nice and hot.

The only reason I'm taking a star off is because the order experience. I had to tell the guy three separate times what my order was, and it took forever for him to get it. Then, when I did, the pie that I asked for half-mushroom half-sausage was all sausage and half mushroom.

Let's see what happens when I order next time.
author: Paul C.

description: Walking around on a Sunday morning with a hungry child (are they ever truly hungry?) is never a pleasant thing, but they had just the thing to ward off the coming gremlins - Breakfast Pizza! and it was so good I got one to go for the rest of the tribe. Had the leftovers the next morning as well, double eats! (the Bottomless mimosas caught my eye too, alas,I didn't have time to enjoy even one).
author: Gavin R.

description:
Pizzeria Avellino is like Arinell without the attitude. Really solid New York style pizza - I ordered a medium pepperoni and it's enough food for at least 3 meals plus a couple of late night drunkie slices.

The restaurant itself is on the small side but is kid friendly and they have a great happy hour deal on beer ($2!!) and slices. Plus everyone working there was über friendly. I used my Fresh Guide coupon to save some money on my pie and to try a new place...thanks to that Avellino will have a repeat customer!
author: phil h.

description: After a night of drinking, came here for a slice of pizza. It was large but greasy and just okay (~$4.50 a slice).
author: Siv L.

description: We had the pleasure of eating here on our last visit to San Francisco - We were staying nearby on Lombard and walked UPHILL for a couple of blocks and this place and it was just great - It was truly one of the best dinners we had in a city of great dinners for us. We had a pepperoni, sausage, mushroom and onion pizza - we got the medium and between us we killed it- it was that good - and the guy at the counter was a Chargers fan to boot - If I ever go back to San Francisco I will surely go back - Thanks for the great dinner
author: Vic c.

description: I went for a long run and ended here. I was starving, and was glad that Avallino sold pizza by the slice. I did not have to wait more than 4 minutes for my pizza. The slice was HUGE. The crust was really great thin Napoli style. The toppings were slightly underdone, as if they were added half way through the cooking process. There is really great outdoor seating, and it's adjacent to the Presidio for your viewing pleasure. The staff is really great.
author: Sarah B.

description: We went here on a whim because all the other restaurants we found here on yelp were either non existent or shut down and I'm so glad we did! I got the caprese panini and the chopped salad, my boyfriend ordered the meatball sandwich and we were so impressed! Reasonably priced and completely delicious. Food didn't take much time at all and it was some of the best I've had in SF. Definitely wanna go back and try out those slices. They looked amazing!
author: Alicia P.

description:
I'm not going into detail other than to say:

Authentic NYC Pizza (period)  

And I actually lived in NYC for 15 years and ate a slice a day - so this ain't coming from a gal who thinks Noahs serves authentic bagels, Noah's rolls maybe - "bagels" - not a chance.
author: Amy W.

description: Great place for kids.  I couldn't believe the bottomless mimosas were $5 with my own pitcher.  Pizza brunch is amazing, and their pizzas are made fresh - super tasty!  Free WiFi = bonus!!!  We love the cozy atmosphere.  If it wasn't so cold in the city, we would have dined outside.  The restroom is clean and staff are friendly.  The owner cautioned me about the huge pizza oven when walking by.  Decent wine selections for a neat pizzeria/cafe!  Sodas are sold by the bottle or can.   I'm coming back with the family.  Parking is available for customers, bingo!
author: Christine R.

description:
We walked over after attending the SF Hip Hop Dance Fest at the Palace of Fine Arts, just 2 blocks away. My son and I like thin crust pizza, so this pizzeria fits that category. 

The three of us only tried 4 slices, so I can comment on how a whole pie would be, but we had the following thin-crust slices:

* cheese for my son
* veggie special of the day (peppers and olives) for me
* meat special of the day (sausage and pepperoni) for husband
* mushroom for husband and me to share

My son was very happy with his cheese pizza. He's picky, so that was a success. My husband and I weren't blown away with our pizza. It was just okay.

They added the toppings before reheating our slices. The peppers on my pizza had a smoky flavor, so I pulled most of them off (not being a fan of smoky flavors). My veggie slice could've been slightly hotter. The mushrooms were just so-so; I found myself comparing them to Speederia in San Carlos (I prefer their thin-crust mushroom pizza). Speederia's toppings are already on each pizza, as opposed to adding toppings before reheating slices like they do here.

We had some root beer. They have no ice (strange), but a good variety of beverages.

Service was friendly. The interior is small, clean, and inviting. The décor is a few steps above your average pizza joint. The posted health inspection report is 96, a very respectable score. Kudos!
